intro: Anaphalis chlamydophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf woollyhead, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and woolly, glandular hairs covering its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Anaphalis chlamydophylla is valued for its ornamental appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique texture and color.
